Sorting and Grouping Data

Clicking a column header sorts the data in the upper pane based on the value in that column. The sort is in ascending order, numeric or alphanumeric, depending on the data. Clicking a header a second time reverses the sort order from ascending to descending. You can also sort the data in the lower pane when the Link tab is selected.

A triangle appears on the sorted column’s column header. The triangle points upward for ascending sorts and downward for descending sorts.`

You can carry out more complicated sorts by using the following procedure.

To perform up to a fourth-order sort:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Right-click a column header on the upper pane. Then Select Sort and Group from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Sort and Group from the appropriate component menu or context menu. This displays the Sort and Group dialog, which has four group boxes, each indented slightly farther to the right. The first group box designates a primary sort order; the second designates a secondary sort, and so on.

  2. (Optional) To list all the fields in First by and Then by drop-down list boxes, select the Show advanced fields check box at the bottom of the dialog. Because some fields are rarely used, they are considered advanced.

  3. Select a field from the First by drop-down list box.

  4. Select the Ascending or Descending option button. The default setting is ascending order.

  5. Select Group by to use group bars to separate the files that have different values in this field.

    6. Important: If you do not select any additional sort options, text fields are sorted in ASCII order, in which uppercase letters precede lowercase letters. Enumerated and user ID fields are sorted by their internal order or internal keys. That is, enumerated fields are sorted in the order assigned to them by the person who created the field and user ID fields are sorted in the order in which they were created. The application disables the Sort Options button for numeric and date/time fields.

  6. (Optional) Select Sort options for additional sorting selections. The Sort Options dialog opens. Select As text to sort enumerated and user ID fields by the names of their possible values. For text fields, As text is your only choice. Clear the Case-sensitive check box to sort alphabetically, or select it to sort in ASCII order.

  7. Repeat steps 3-5 to add secondary and lower order sorts using the Then by list box.

  8. When you have entered all of the desired information, click OK.
